Interface VirtualViewSocket

All Superinterfaces:
VirtualView
All Known Implementing Classes:
SocketClient, SocketClientHandler
public interface VirtualViewSocket extends VirtualView

    • error

      void error() throws Exception
      Handles an error within the VirtualViewSocket context. This method may be invoked when an unexpected or critical issue occurs, requiring appropriate error handling or reporting mechanisms.
      Specified by:
      error in interface VirtualView
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the execution of the method.

    • ping

      void ping() throws IOException
      Sends a ping operation to verify connectivity or response time. This method is used to check the liveness of the connection or responsiveness of a specific endpoint in the virtual view socket.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there are any issues while performing the ping operation.

    • updateGameCreated

      void updateGameCreated(int level, List<Deck> ShowableDecks, ArrayList<Player> players, int hourglass, int surrender) throws Exception
      Updates the game state to reflect a new game that has been created. This includes initializing game parameters such as the level, showable decks, players, hourglass count, and surrender count.
      Specified by:
      updateGameCreated in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      level - The level of the new game being created.
      ShowableDecks - A list of decks available and visible to players.
      players - The list of players participating in the game.
      hourglass - The amount of hourglass resources available in the game.
      surrender - The number of surrender opportunities remaining in the game.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the update process.

    • insertTileLMR

      void insertTileLMR(int TileIndex, int r, int c, int rotation, String playerNickname) throws Exception
      Inserts a tile into the game board at a specified position and orientation for a given player. It represents a game action where the tile details are provided, and the player executing the action is identified.
      Specified by:
      insertTileLMR in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      TileIndex - the index of the tile being inserted
      r - the row position on the board where the tile should be inserted
      c - the column position on the board where the tile should be inserted
      rotation - the rotation of the tile (in degrees or game-specific rotation unit)
      playerNickname - the nickname of the player performing the action
      Throws:
      Exception - if the action cannot be completed due to invalid input or game rules

    • updateAddGoods

      void updateAddGoods(Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posGoods, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> goodsSets) throws Exception

      Specified by:
      updateAddGoods in interface VirtualView
      Parameters:
      player - The player to whom the goods will be added.
      posGoods - A list of positions specifying where the goods should be added. Each inner list represents a set of positions in the player's storage or board.
      goodsSets - A list of sets of goods to be added. Each inner list contains goods corresponding to positions specified in the `posGoods` parameter.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the update cannot be completed or encounters an error.
